to

Secret security clearance.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Manufacturing Engineer

Location: Fairborn, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
RGBSI Aerospace & Defense LLC is dedicated to providing the highest quality of services to our clients and employees.We are proud to be the primary partner to top companies in the automotive, aerospace, and defense industries. As a result of our continued growth, we are looking for energetic and personable professionals to join our team.
Position Summary:As a Manufacturing Engineer [v] II you will serve as an engineering & manufacturing subject matter expert for RGBSI A&D across various programs requiring product design and development knowledge. Your knowledge and expertise will be widely applied across RGBSI A&D's broad client base from various industry domains such as aerospace, automotive, other defense sectors. You will provide leadership around new technologies and methodologies while working with RGBSI A&D clients in defining the future state for their engineering and manufacturing strategies. The Manufacturing Engineer Lv] Il is responsible for designing, implementing, analyzing, and reviewing the procedures and processes involved in manufacturing.
As a key member of the RGBSI Aerospace & Defense Customer Engagement Team, the Manufacturing Engineer Ix! II is responsible for executing against key milestones and deliverable timelines. This role requires client-facing interaction with project teams in meeting aggressive timelines and delivering effective client solutions.

Responsibilities• Drive the development and innovation of GBSI A&D branded solutions and offerings to be used across DoD and commercial industry sectors• Perform and review design failure mode and effects analysis (DFMEA) and process failure mode and effects analysis (PFMEA) to identify and assess design and manufacturing risks• Conduct and review analyses of part production processes, control plans, schedules, methods, and other data to better understand future requirements needed for customers' manufacturing processes• Conduct supplier audits for manufacturing capabilities and quality management systems• Oversee analyses of machine, material, model preparation for additive manufacturing projects• Drive technical execution of projects around focus areas of Industry 4.0 / Digital Factory / Model-basedEnterprise / Advanced Manufacturing / Additive Manufacturing• Perform accurate / professional documentation and presentation of technical data, analyses, and reports• Review manufacturing instructions, methods, and processes to identify and improve customer efficiency• Develop manufacturing process strategy documentation with supporting technical analysis for improvements• Work with suppliers to solve engineering and manufacturing feasibility questions in real time• Support active feedback between customers and the RGBSI A&D team to drive improvements• Review part production run results, including dimensional & test results, to verify "as designed" vs.• Partner effectively with RGBSI A&D project/ program management, technical team, and customer to deliver according agreed plans and schedules•Demonstrated ability to take ownership of issues as they arise and initiate corrective actions•Ability to manage deliverables and execute tasks on time with minimal oversight•Work with end-user groups to evaluate and solve technical problems

Requirements
Bachelor of science degree in aerospace engineering, electrical engineering, manufacturing engineering, mechanical engineering, or industrial engineering3+ years related engineering experienceAbility to handle multiple projects and deadlines concurrentlyExpertise in GD&1Understanding of PPAP through PPAP Level 5Experience with manufacturing, assembly, and testing of machined, forged/cast, or fabricated aerospace parts Experience with design for manufacturing, assembly, reliability, and cost Demonstrated time management and project management skillsSkills to communicate complex ideas effectively and work with business and technical stakeholdersExcellent verbal communication, interpersonal, and influential skillsAvailability for travel to customer locations as required estimated at up to 50% – client dependent


Desired Qualifications Experience with additive manufacturing processesCAD experience( Creo/NX/Solidworks preferred)LEAN, Six Sigma, or ofher process certifications AS9100D/IATF 16949:2016 Auditor

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
